summary: REQ-9 is about deploying the current build to a live environment without changing product features. The diff primarily adds deployment documentation and a smoke-test checklist, but also modifies backend/main.mo with substantial functional code (authorization, profiles, conversations), which goes beyond deployment and does not itself demonstrate a live deployment was performed/configured.

missing_requirements.requirement: Trigger a build and deploy the current YAR-WAHTSAPP application to the live (publicly accessible) environment.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows documentation additions but no concrete deployment configuration or automation changes (e.g., CI/CD workflow, dfx deploy scripts/config changes) and no evidence of a performed deployment or live URL/configuration being set up.
evidence: <file-diff> (no CI/CD or dfx config changes shown)

hallucinated_features.description: Backend functional changes including introducing/initializing an access control system and adding/altering authorization checks and messaging/profile logic.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest is a deployment-only request with an explicit non-goal of changing product features; modifying backend/main.mo with new/changed behavior is outside the requested scope.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a deployment runbook and a live-environment smoke test checklist.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-9 asks to deploy; adding documentation is not explicitly requested and does not itself satisfy “deploy to live”.
